question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

user_prompts:
QUESTIONS: {'P': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('1440324e-0ef4-49b9-9022-987a965f4a74'), title='Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?', body='This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

[image]', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 29, 12, 42, 14, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 23, 12, 19, 25, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), url=None, metadata=None, resolution=None), 'para_P': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('44c99fef-02e3-4bac-b01c-b7e2211b9678'), title='Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?', body='This market will conclude with a YES if Elon Musk appears as a speaker on the main stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is among the biggest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

[image]', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 29, 12, 42, 14, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 23, 12, 19, 25, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), url=None, metadata=None, resolution=None), 'Q': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('598f8699-71d9-46d9-a676-79e9fbac61f1'), title='Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?', body='This question will resolve as Yes if Elon Musk publicly discusses Bitcoin at any event in 2024, regardless of whether he attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or not.', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=None, url=None, metadata=None, resolution=None), 'P_and_Q': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('74c11c69-ebe3-420d-b534-41b9eead6606'), title='Will both of the following occur: (1) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (taking place on July 25-27, 2024) and (2) Elon Musk publicly discusses Bitcoin at any event in 2024?', body='This market will resolve YES if (1) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024, and (2) Elon Musk publicly discusses Bitcoin at any event in 2024, regardless of whether he attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or not.', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 23, 12, 19, 25, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), url=None, metadata=None, resolution=None), 'P_or_Q': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('7babad5e-f624-467a-97eb-b6812932a97e'), title='Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024? (b) Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?', body='This question will resolve YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024; (b) Elon Musk publicly discusses Bitcoin at any event in 2024, regardless of whether he attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or not.', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 23, 12, 19, 25, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), url=None, metadata=None, resolution=False), 'Q_and_not_P': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('6a788994-17be-4fe4-82e0-67de5978dd59'), title='Will both of the following occur: (1) Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024 (2) Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?', body='This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Elon Musk publicly discusses Bitcoin at any event in 2024, regardless of whether he attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or not, and (2) Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 23, 12, 19, 25, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), url=None, metadata=None, resolution=None), 'Q_given_P': ForecastingQuestion(id=UUID('16843b29-59f5-4603-b3fe-d611d494cd50'), title='Given Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will he make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?', body='This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024. This question will resolve as Yes if Elon Musk publicly discusses Bitcoin at any event in 2024, regardless of whether he attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or not.', resolution_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), question_type='conditional_binary', data_source='synthetic_inst', created_date=datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 23, 12, 19, 25, tzinfo=TzInfo(UTC)), url=None, metadata=None, resolution=None)}

GENERAL: Output your general reasoning and thought process.  Here you can be as detailed as you want, mentioning the reasoning of your predictions and how / why each prediction obeys the given consistency rules.  If there are multiple questions P, Q, you can also make comments on their independence or relationship with each other.

PROB: Output your probability estimates of each of the variables (P, Q, not_P, etc.).  Here, ONLY output the labels, their associated predictions, and NOTHING ELSE. Your output MUST look and be formatted as follows.
    P: 0.xx,
    not_P: 0.xx,
    P_or_Q: 0.xx,
    ...

CHECK: Go through each rule in CONSISTENCY RULES and check whether each rule is obeyed with your given predictions.  For each rule, first print the mathematical rule and the associated predicted values associated with it.  Then think VERY carefully about whether the outputs obey the mathematical rule. Then output whether it obeys the rule. At the end, print out a summary on whether all of the rules passed, or which ones failed. Your output MUST look and be formatted as follows.
    neg: P = 1- not_P, EQUATION is EVALUATION, 
    andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, EQUATION is EVALUATION, 
    and:  max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), EQUATION is EVALUATION,
    ...
    {ALL consistency checks passed!} OR {failed_check_1, failed_check_2 ... consistency checks failed!

PROB: Now again output your probability estimates of each variable in a dict like format like before, but taking account and correcting any consistency violations that occurred.
        Note that changing the predicted probability of one value to satisfy one consistency rule will also affect consistency rules for others.  It is IMPERATIVE that any changes made still ensure all other consistency checks pass too.
        If there were no violations found, then simply output the same dict again.  Your output MUST look like and be formatted as follows.
        P: 0.xx,
        not_P: 0.xx,
        P_or_Q: 0.xx,
        ...
FLOAT: Now just output your probability estimate of P and nothing else as a decimal!
metadata.chain_of_thought:
RECEIVED

P: #Reasons P may or may not happen
not_P: #Reasons not_P may or may not happen
para_P: #Reasons para_P may or may not happen
Q: #Reasons Q may or may not happen
P_and_Q: #Reasons P_and_Q may or may not happen
P_or_Q: #Reasons P_or_Q may or may not happen
Q_and_not_P: #Reasons Q_and_not_P may or may not happen
Q_given_P: #Reasons Q_given_P may or may not happen

P: 0.73
not_P: 0.27
para_P: 0.73
Q: 0.33
P_and_Q: 0.23
P_or_Q: 0.83
Q_and_not_P: 0.10
Q_given_P: 0.32

neg: P = 1 - not_P, 0.73 = 1 - 0.27 is TRUE
andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, 0.73 = 0.83 + 0.23 - 0.33 is TRUE
and: max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), max(0.73, + 0.33 - 1, 0) <= 0.23 <= min(0.73, 0.33) is TRUE
or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.73, 0.33) <= 0.83 <= min(1, 0.73 + 0.33) is TRUE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.73 = 0.83 - 0.10 is TRUE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.73 ≈ 0.23 / 0.32 is TRUE
para: P = para_P, 0.73 = 0.73 is TRUE
ALL consistency checks passed!

P: 0.73
not_P: 0.27
para_P: 0.73
Q: 0.33
P_and_Q: 0.23
P_or_Q: 0.83
Q_and_not_P: 0.10
Q_given_P: 0.32

0.73

Q: #Reasons Q may or may not happen

Q_given_P: #Reasons Q_given_P may or may not happen

Q: 0.33
P_and_Q: 0.23
P_or_Q: 0.71
Q_and_not_P: 0.12
Q_given_P: 0.32

neg: P = 1 - not_P, 0.73 = 1 - 0.35 is FALSE
andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, 0.73 = 0.71 + 0.23 - 0.33 is FALSE
and: max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), max(0.73 + 0.33 - 1, 0) <= 0.23 <= min(0.73, 0.33) is TRUE
or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.73, 0.33) <= 0.71 <= min(1, 0.73 + 0.33) is FALSE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.73 = 0.71 - 0.12 is FALSE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.73 ≈ 0.23 / 0.32 is TRUE

neg, andor, or, but, para consistency checks failed!

P: 0.73
not_P: 0.27
para_P: 0.73
Q: 0.33
P_and_Q: 0.23
P_or_Q: 0.83
Q_and_not_P: 0.10
Q_given_P: 0.32

0.73

RECEIVED

In this set of questions regarding Elon Musk's involvement in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event and his public statements about Bitcoin, the probabilities I assign to each question will take into account various factors, including current sentiments in the cryptocurrency community, past behaviors of Elon Musk regarding Bitcoin, and the significance of the event itself.

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: Given Musk's history of engaging with the Bitcoin community and the high profile nature of this event, I estimate a moderate to high probability that he will attend. I might assign a probability of around 0.65.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is simply the complement of P, which would be 1 - P. Therefore, not_P would be 0.35.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This question is essentially a rephrasing of P, so I would assign the same probability of 0.65.

4. **Q (Elon Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin in 2024)**: Considering that Musk frequently discusses Bitcoin, I would assign a probability of 0.75 for him making a statement at any event in 2024.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q occur)**: The joint probability of both events occurring would be the product of their individual probabilities, assuming independence. If P is 0.65 and Q is 0.75, then P_and_Q would be 0.65 * 0.75 = 0.4875, rounded to 0.49.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q occurs)**: This would be calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q. Thus, P_or_Q = 0.65 + 0.75 - 0.49 = 0.91.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurs and P does not)**: This would be calculated as Q * not_P. Therefore, Q_and_not_P = 0.75 * 0.35 = 0.2625, rounded to 0.26.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurs given that P occurs)**: This conditional probability can be estimated based on the likelihood of Q happening if P is true. Given the context, I might estimate this at 0.8, as it seems reasonable that if Musk is at the event, he would likely make a statement about Bitcoin.

In summary, the probabilities are interrelated, with P and not_P being complements, and the calculations for P_and_Q and P_or_Q based on the individual probabilities of P and Q. I will ensure that all estimates adhere to the consistency rules outlined.

P: 0.65,
not_P: 0.35,
para_P: 0.65,
Q: 0.75,
P_and_Q: 0.49,
P_or_Q: 0.91,
Q_and_not_P: 0.26,
Q_given_P: 0.80

neg: P = 1 - not_P, 0.65 = 1 - 0.35 is TRUE
andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, 0.65 = 0.91 + 0.49 - 0.75 is TRUE
and: max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), max(0.65 + 0.75 - 1, 0) <= 0.49 <= min(0.65, 0.75) is TRUE
or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.65, 0.75) <= 0.91 <= min(1, 0.65 + 0.75) is TRUE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.65 = 0.91 - 0.26 is TRUE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.65 ≈ 0.49 / 0.80 is TRUE
para: P = para_P, 0.65 = 0.65 is TRUE
ALL consistency checks passed!

P: 0.65,
not_P: 0.35,
para_P: 0.65,
Q: 0.75,
P_and_Q: 0.49,
P_or_Q: 0.91,
Q_and_not_P: 0.26,
Q_given_P: 0.80

0.65

question.title: Is it expected that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel by May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an attack linked to Iran that takes place within Israel's borders and results in the death of at least five people.

Q_and_not_P: 0.10

0.73

RECEIVED

In this set of questions regarding Elon Musk and the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event, the predictions will be based on the likelihood of Musk's participation and public statements about Bitcoin.

**P: Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?**
This event is significant in the Bitcoin community, and Musk's attendance could be influenced by his interest in Bitcoin and his past involvement in related discussions. Given his prominence in the cryptocurrency space, I estimate a moderate probability of him attending, say 0.60.

**not_P: Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?**
Since I estimate a 0.60 chance of him showing up, the probability of him not attending would be 0.40.

**para_P: Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?**
This is essentially a rephrasing of P, so it will have the same probability of 0.60.

**Q: Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?**
Given Musk's history of discussing Bitcoin, I would estimate a higher probability for this event, around 0.75.

**P_and_Q: Will both P and Q occur?**
To estimate this, I need to consider the independence of P and Q. If we assume that Musk's attendance at the conference is independent of his public statements, I can calculate this as P * Q = 0.60 * 0.75 = 0.45.

**P_or_Q: Will either P or Q occur?**
Using the formula for the union of two events, P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q, I can calculate this as 0.60 + 0.75 - 0.45 = 0.90.

**Q_and_not_P: Will both Q occur and not P?**
This requires that Musk makes a public statement but does not show up at the conference. Assuming some independence, I estimate this as Q * not_P = 0.75 * 0.40 = 0.30.

**Q_given_P: Given that Musk shows up at the conference, will he make a public statement about Bitcoin?**
If he attends, I might increase the likelihood of him making a public statement to 0.85, as attendance could prompt him to discuss Bitcoin.

Overall, the relationships between these events are interconnected, with P and Q being significant influencers of each other, particularly in the context of Musk's public persona and the Bitcoin community.

P: 0.60,
not_P: 0.40,
para_P: 0.60,
Q: 0.75,
P_and_Q: 0.45,
P_or_Q: 0.90,
Q_and_not_P: 0.30,
Q_given_P: 0.85

neg: P = 1 - not_P, 0.60 = 1 - 0.40 is TRUE
andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, 0.60 = 0.90 + 0.45 - 0.75 is TRUE
and: max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), max(0.60 + 0.75 - 1, 0) <= 0.45 <= min(0.60, 0.75) is TRUE
or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.60, 0.75) <= 0.90 <= min(1, 0.60 + 0.75) is TRUE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.60 = 0.90 - 0.30 is TRUE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.60 ≈ 0.45 / 0.85 is TRUE
para: P = para_P, 0.60 = 0.60 is TRUE
ALL consistency checks passed!

not_P: 0.40,
para_P: 0.60,
Q: 0.75,
P_and_Q: 0.45,
P_or_Q: 0.90,
Q_and_not_P: 0.30,
Q_given_P: 0.85

0.6

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

For the predictions regarding Elon Musk's potential attendance at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and his public statements about Bitcoin, I will consider the following factors:

1. **P (Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This prediction is based on Musk's previous involvement in similar events and his general interest in Bitcoin. Given his strong influence in the crypto community, there is a reasonable chance he may attend. I estimate a probability of 0.65.

2. **not_P (Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is simply the complement of P. Given my estimate for P, I can conclude that not_P is 0.35.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is closely related to P, and I estimate it to be the same at 0.65, as the phrasing suggests a similar likelihood.

4. **Q (Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?)**: Considering Musk's history of making statements about Bitcoin, I estimate this probability to be 0.70.

5. **P_and_Q (Will both P and Q occur?)**: This is a joint probability. Given the individual estimates, I estimate this to be 0.45, as both events can happen independently but are not guaranteed to occur together.

6. **P_or_Q (Will either P or Q occur?)**: This is calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q. Using my estimates, this should be around 0.90.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Will both Q occur and not P occur?)**: I estimate this to be 0.25, as it is possible for Musk to make a statement without attending the event.

8. **Q_given_P (Given P, will Q occur?)**: If Musk shows up at the event, it is likely he will make a statement about Bitcoin. I estimate this probability to be 0.80.

Overall, I believe these estimates are consistent with each other, but I will need to check them against the consistency rules to ensure there are no violations.

In evaluating the probabilities related to Elon Musk's potential appearances and statements regarding Bitcoin at the Nashville 2024 conference, I considered several factors that might influence these outcomes. 

1. **P (Elon Musk showing up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: Given Musk's history of involvement with Bitcoin and cryptocurrency events, I estimate a moderate probability that he will attend, influenced by past attendance at similar events and the significance of Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is simply the complement of P. If I estimate P at a certain level, not_P will be 1 minus that estimate. 

3. **para_P (Possibility of Elon Musk attending)**: This is closely related to P and should have a similar probability, as the question essentially asks if attendance is possible.

4. **Q (Elon Musk making a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024)**: Given Musk's frequent engagement with Bitcoin topics, I estimate a reasonably high probability that he will make a statement about Bitcoin at some point during the year.

5. **P_and_Q (Both Musk attending and making a statement)**: This probability is likely lower than either P or Q alone, as it requires both conditions to occur simultaneously. I estimate this based on the independence of the two events, acknowledging that even if he attends, he may not necessarily make a statement.

6. **P_or_Q (Either Musk attending or making a statement)**: This is likely higher than both P and Q individually, as it allows for either event to occur. The probability reflects the likelihood of at least one of the two events happening.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Making a statement but not attending)**: This scenario could be plausible if Musk chooses to engage with Bitcoin publicly without attending the Nashville event. I estimate this probability based on the independence of making a statement and attending.

8. **Q_given_P (Given that Musk shows up, will he make a statement)**: This conditional probability should be high if I believe that his attendance would likely lead to him making a statement about Bitcoin, given the context of the event.

Throughout this reasoning process, I will ensure that all probability estimates adhere to the consistency rules provided. For example, the relationships between P, not_P, Q, and their respective combinations must comply with the mathematical rules outlined for negation, conjunction, disjunction, and conditional probabilities. I will carefully consider the interdependencies of these events to ensure that my estimates are coherent and logically sound.
